intro: Saussurea pseudoyunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, lanceolate, and covered with dense white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
